net.foxycorndog.jfoxylib.font

Class Font

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.foxycorndog.jfoxylib.font.Font

  • public class Font
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to load an image full of glyphs and bring them to function as a Font that can render Strings according to the given character set of the Font image.
    Since:
    Apr 26, 2013 at 10:46:35 PM, v0.2
    Version:
    Apr 26, 2013 at 10:46:35 PM, v0.2
    Author:
    Braden Steffaniak

    • Constructor Detail

      • Font

        public Font(java.lang.String location,
    int cols,
    int rows,
    char[] charSequence)
     throws java.io.IOException
        Create a Font from the image at the specified location. The Font image will be split up into the specified amount of columns and rows. Each of the characters will correspond with the given charSequence char array.
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the Font image.
        cols - The number of columns in the Font image.
        rows - The number of rows in the Font image.
        charSequence - The character array that corresponds with each Character in the Font image.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the Font image file was not found.

      • Font

        public Font(SpriteSheet sprites,
    char[] charSequence)
        Create a Font from the specified SpriteSheet. Each of the characters will correspond with the given charSequence char array.
        Parameters:
        sprites - The SpriteSheet that holds all of the characters. It must be split into the correct divisions for each letter to work properly.
        charSequence - The character array that corresponds with each Character in the Font image.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the Font image file was not found.

    • Method Detail

      • doesTrimBounds

        public boolean doesTrimBounds()
        Get whether or not the Bounds for the Font's Glyphs have been trimmed and prepared to fit together like a PBJ sandwich baby.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the Bounds have been trimmed neatly.

      • setTrimBounds

        public void setTrimBounds(boolean trim)
        Whether or not to trim the Glyphs Bounds so that they fit perfectly together in beautiful harmony. Yes, do it.
        Parameters:
        trim - Whether or not to trim the Bounds.

      • getRenderBounds

        public Bounds2f getRenderBounds(java.lang.String text,
                       float x,
                       float y,
                       float scale,
                       int horizontalAlignment,
                       int verticalAlignment,
                       Panel panel)
        Get the Bounds that the Font render will take up with the specified text, location, scale, alignment, and panel given to it.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to get the Bounds with.
        x - The horizontal location that the text would be rendered to.
        y - The vertical location that the text would be rendered to.
        scale - The scale that the Font would be rendered by.
        horizontalAlignment - The horizontal alignment that the text will be aligned by.
        verticalAlignment - The vertical alignment that the text will be aligned by.
        panel - The Panel that the Font will be rendered inside of. Passing a null value here will result in the Panel being treated of as the Frame.
        Returns:
        The Bounds that the text will take up after rendered.

      • render

        public Bounds2f render(java.lang.String text,
              float x,
              float y,
              float z,
              Panel panel)
        Render the text at the specified location to the specified Panel.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to render to the Panel.
        x - The horizontal location to render the text.
        y - The vertical location to render the text.
        z - The oblique location to render the text.
        panel - The Panel to render the text inside of. Passing a null value here will result in the Panel being treated of as the Frame.
        Returns:
        The Bounds that the text was rendered inside of.

      • render

        public Bounds2f render(java.lang.String text,
              float x,
              float y,
              float z,
              Panel panel,
              boolean saveHistory)
        Render the text at the specified location to the specified Panel.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to render to the Panel.
        x - The horizontal location to render the text.
        y - The vertical location to render the text.
        z - The oblique location to render the text.
        panel - The Panel to render the text inside of. Passing a null value here will result in the Panel being treated of as the Frame.
        saveHistory - Whether or not to save the specified text to the history buffer.
        Returns:
        The Bounds that the text was rendered inside of.
